com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface cancelOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface cancelOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document cancelOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The cancelOrder API will understand how to cancel not only the order and the individual order lines, but it also manages the Stop Delivery Requests that are necessary for the order lines that are beyond the point of cancellation.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document cancelOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        The cancelOrder API will understand how to cancel not only the order and the individual order lines, but it also manages the Stop Delivery Requests that are necessary for the order lines that are beyond the point of cancellation. This is configured through status modification permissions and can be disabled by the customer business process if necessary. The input will contain the order identifier. If the entire order is to be cancelled, no additional input is required. However, if specific order lines or order line quantities are going to be cancelled, this api will take that information, and determine the best way to cancel the order line quantities depending on the status modification permission and configuration of the Stop Delivery Request modification type.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: A valid order must be provided.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. This contains the order and if applicable any specific order lines and the quantities to cancel. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the list of order holds discovered on the order output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
